item.title: Getting started with dojo
item.description: Installation or Setup # Use Dojo from CDN Load Dojo through <script> tags in your HTML page pointing to Google CDN. Example: <script src="//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/dojo/1.11.2/dojo/dojo.js"></script> Install Dojo with Bower Type the following command in your project directory: bower install dojo/dojo dojo/dijit dojo/dojox dojo/util Bower installs to a bower_components sub-directory by default, but if you’d like to install to the current directory instead add a .bowerrc with the following: { "directory": "." } Use dojo themes from CDN # Dojo provides us various themes like tundra, claro etc.

item.title: Configuring Dojo with dojoConfig
item.description: The dojoConfig object (formerly djConfig) allows you to set options and default behavior for various aspects of the dojo toolkit. Examples will explain what’s possible and how you can put dojoConfig to use in your code. Note that dojoConfig is defined in a script block before dojo.js is loaded. This is of paramount importanceâ€”if reversed, the configuration properties will be ignored. Loader Configuration # Dojo received a new loader in Dojo 1.

item.title: DOM Manipulation
item.description: Dojo provides different functions that allows you to manipulate DOM elements such as creation, placement and destruction. Parameters # Argument Type node DomNode or String dom-construct # This module can be used to : Create a new element. Delete an element from HTML document. Place element in HTML document. Iinitialisation # To be able to use the dom-construct module we need to load it as fallow : require(["dojo/dom-construct"], function(domConstruct){ // Write code here }); create() # This function can be used to create an element and add it in a specific position.

item.title: Hello Dojo
item.description: A simple Hello Dojo like Hello World in other programming languages. Dojo is simple to install/configure and use. You can download the latest version of Dojo from http://dojotoolkit.org/download/ or you can use what is called CDN’s in your project. I prefer to download and use it.
